Rectosigmoid tumor (5.9 cm long and up to 3.3 cm thick) with extension beyond the muscularis propria, multiple perirectal and perisigmoid lymph nodes (up to 0.8 cm by 0.6 cm), and a left external iliac lymph node (1.1 cm by 0.7 cm).

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT study with oral and intravenous contrast
radiographic_examinations.findings: Rectal mass causing abrupt narrowing of the rectal lumen (approximately 6 cm long and up to 3.3 cm thick); small perirectal, left external iliac-chain, and left paraaortic lymph nodes; a 1-cm lymph node in the left inguinal region.

Perirectal lymph node and rectal mass with heterogeneous intermediate signal on T2-weighted axial image; loss of normal hypointense muscularis propria and extension of gray-appearing tumor beyond its expected margin, consistent with a T3 tumor.
Reactive lymphoid tissue with no cancer.
